analysis.Summary: FieldBig.vue is a Vue 3 component that renders an input field with an optional auto-typing placeholder animation and an action button. It manages user input state, placeholder cycling, typing animation (with blinking cursor), and emits events for parent components.
analysis.Purpose: To provide a stylized, self-contained input component with placeholder typing animation and an optional action trigger, used wherever a prominent input with call-to-action is needed in the application.

Components.name: Field
Components.responsibility: Wrapped input component (v-model binding), handles core text input, focus, blur, and emits update events.

Components.name: IconArrow
Components.responsibility: Renders a right-pointing arrow icon inside the action button.

Functions.name: emitAction
Functions.description: Emits the 'action' event when the action button is clicked.

Functions.name: updateInput
Functions.description: Emits 'update:input' with the new input value and stores it in userText.

Functions.name: handleInput
Functions.description: Advances the placeholder index to cycle through placeholderTexts on each user input.

Functions.name: handleFocus
Functions.description: Stops typing animation on focus, resets placeholder to static value, and clears the field if the user hasnâ€™t typed.

Functions.name: checkInput
Functions.description: On blur, if no user text and typing is enabled, restarts the typing animation.

Functions.name: startTyping
Functions.description: Initiates the placeholder typing animation with blinking cursor, handles forward/backward typing, looping logic, and placeholder cycling.

Dependencies: vue: ref, watchEffect, onMounted, defineProps, defineEmits
analysis.Usage: Import FieldBig.vue into parent components and bind via `<FieldBig v-model:input="myValue" :placeholder="'Enter text'" :action="'Go'" :enableTyping="true"/>`. Listen for `update:input` and `action` events.
Notes: Implements a looping, bidirectional typing animation with configurable speed and looping.
Cursor blinking is implemented via a separate interval.
Clears intervals on blur or when typing stops to prevent memory leaks.
Supports localization via `vue-i18n` and dynamic placeholderLists per locale.
